item.title: Large storage box in communal garden, 13th July
item.description:
In the communal garden where I live there is a large storage box which needs removing. I do not know how it came to be in the garden left up against a wall but it has been there for some time. There is also some other litter scattered about in the garden but I cannot see what it/ they may be. Can this storage box and other litter be cleared. Thank you On a separate note I have sent a request regarding one of the shed doors behind the first block in Strongbow Road. There was a typing error on this request and it should have stated shed door. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Strongbow Crescent, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary lights not working, 13th July
item.description:
Temporary light going towards Nowood Junction are not working. I think they are constantly on red. Since this morning they have been like that. Lots of people honking their horns and going through the light
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 166, Croydon Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter and large box in footpath 159, 13th July
item.description:
Often litter down this footpath but sometimes it's really clear, especially when a community litter picker has worked the footpath. Today there was litter and a large black box that needs clearing. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Road, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: She’s door has been forced open and debris has been thrown around, 13th July
item.description:
One of the shed doors adjacent to the first block in Strongbow Road has been opened and it appears an old lawnmower has been taken apart and debris has been left on the ground. On a separate note the ground could also do with a sweep and clean up. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43, Passey Place, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car parks daily in front of emergency barrier in Foxes Field, 13th July
item.description:
This woman parks at least once a day, usually twice in front of the emergency barrier in foxes field to walk her dog for 30mg a, if an emergency were to occur the emergency services vehicles would be unable to get through, there are 2 car parks which she could use further up the drive. A large sign is needed to ensure the emergency barrier is not blocked.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grove Park Road, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More Rubbish ….!!!, 13th July
item.description:
They’ve been out again overnight and dumped all of their filth in the park. This is a health hazard. Soiled nappies and running alive with flies. I have no complaints about Peabody clearing these issues once reported and I appreciate the extent of the problem in the area but when will Peabody tackle this constant problem? Look at the number of reports for this particular spot, surely something could be done to catch these people. Does anyone look through this rubbish for any evidence?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Campion Place, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rabbit/Animal holes, 13th July
item.description:
Over by the right hand start of the obstacle course, there are at least 3 big holes in the ground. Children are running around and over these holes everyday. And it could cause a child to fall or potentially break a bone if their leg got wedged. Close by there is also what appears to be a left over metal buckle and screw sticking up out of the ground from previous playground furniture which is stuck. A child could really hurt themselves if they they fell in the screw/bolt.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwood Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken manhole cover on St Agnes Place, Kennington, 13th July

Broken manhole cover on St Agnes Place, Kennington. Near to Rose Apartments.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, St. Agnes Place, Kennington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged and overflowing recycling bins and litter, 13th July
item.description:
This spot has become a real problem area for general waste being left out. The recycling bins are being used for food waste (ie. Unfinished takeaways). For several months there has been a regular accumulation of general waste litter left next to the bins.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Crondall Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeding and general upkeep of area, 13th July
item.description:
Have Lambeth given up? Why is the Bloomhall estate such a mess? Weeding needs doing along whole street, litter picking, sweeping etc.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Durning Road, West Norwood, London

item.title: Broken glass and litter and pavement and road, 13th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Canon Road, Widmore, London

item.title: Glebe road, filthy rubbish overflowing left in street, 13th July
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Middleton Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Constant Flytipping, 13th July
item.description:
There is constant fly tipping on the corner of Benthal Road - every single week there are piles of rubbish. Please can we request some sort of signage to deter people from doing it? Thank you so much
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Common, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
